input: <web-search>Find current information about: document image augmentation OCR text similarity 2024</web-search>
output:
Here’s a concise 2024 snapshot that ties together document image augmentation, OCR, and text similarity, with links for follow‑up:

**Current 2024 highlights**
- Document image augmentation is moving toward joint text‑image transformations that preserve text fidelity while still diversifying layout/appearance; Hugging Face + Albumentations’ “TextImage Augmentation for Document Images” tutorial emphasizes augmentation that keeps text readable and aligned across modalities. Source: https://huggingface.co/blog/doc_aug_hf_alb
- OCR‑adjacent text similarity is being handled without OCR in some workflows: “Text Change Detection in Multilingual Documents Using Image Comparison” proposes word‑level image‑to‑image comparison with multi‑scale attention correlations to detect textual changes across languages, avoiding OCR model selection issues. Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/2412.04137
- Post‑OCR correction work in 2024 uses synthetic data and explicit glyph‑similarity signals to build training pairs; “Advancing Post‑OCR Correction: A Comparative Study of Synthetic Data” introduces a glyph‑similarity‑based synthesis method and shows ByT5 reducing CER across multiple languages, especially low‑resource. Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/2408.02253

If you want, I can dig into one of these areas deeper (e.g., concrete augmentation recipes, OCR similarity metrics, or model comparisons).

trajectory.content:
Here’s a concise 2024 snapshot that ties together document image augmentation, OCR, and text similarity, with links for follow‑up:

**Current 2024 highlights**
- Document image augmentation is moving toward joint text‑image transformations that preserve text fidelity while still diversifying layout/appearance; Hugging Face + Albumentations’ “TextImage Augmentation for Document Images” tutorial emphasizes augmentation that keeps text readable and aligned across modalities. Source: https://huggingface.co/blog/doc_aug_hf_alb
- OCR‑adjacent text similarity is being handled without OCR in some workflows: “Text Change Detection in Multilingual Documents Using Image Comparison” proposes word‑level image‑to‑image comparison with multi‑scale attention correlations to detect textual changes across languages, avoiding OCR model selection issues. Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/2412.04137
- Post‑OCR correction work in 2024 uses synthetic data and explicit glyph‑similarity signals to build training pairs; “Advancing Post‑OCR Correction: A Comparative Study of Synthetic Data” introduces a glyph‑similarity‑based synthesis method and shows ByT5 reducing CER across multiple languages, especially low‑resource. Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/2408.02253

If you want, I can dig into one of these areas deeper (e.g., concrete augmentation recipes, OCR similarity metrics, or model comparisons).

input: <web-search>Find current information about: 한국 정부사이트 PDF 다운로드 curl SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL 해결 2026</web-search>
output:
한국 정부사이트 PDF 다운로드에서 `curl`의 `SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL`을 해결하려는 요청으로 보이며, 최신 근거는 2025년 글들이라 2026년 전용 변화는 확인되지 않았습니다. 대신 2025년 기준으로 공통 원인/해결책을 정리해 드립니다.

**핵심 원인 (2025년 기준)**
- `SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL`은 SSL/TLS 핸드셰이크 단계에서 소켓 레벨 오류가 난 “범용 오류”로, 네트워크 문제, 방화벽/프록시, 서버 측 설정 문제 등 다양한 원인을 가리킬 수 있음. `curl`/OpenSSL 버전, TLS 버전 호환 문제도 흔함. (CodeGenes 2025-11-27)
- `curl`이 `wget`보다 인증서 검증에 더 엄격해서, HTTPS 다운로드에서 `curl`만 실패하고 `wget`은 되는 케이스가 실제로 있음. (Tistory 2025-04-23)
- `SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL`은 기본적으로 “서버가 연결을 끊었거나 TLS 협상이 실패” 같은 상황에서 발생하므로, TLS 버전/암호군/프록시/네트워크를 체계적으로 점검해야 함. (howtouselinux 2025-10-09 수정)

**한국 정부 사이트 PDF 다운로드에서 자주 쓰는 실무 해결책**
- TLS 버전 강제: 정부 사이트/WAF가 TLS 1.3 협상에 민감한 경우가 있어서 `--tlsv1.2` 또는 `--tls-max 1.2`.
- HTTP/2 회피: 일부 서버는 `h2` 협상에서 끊길 수 있어 `--http1.1`.
- 브라우저 흉내: `--user-agent`, `--referer`, `--cookie`로 세션/권한 유지.
- CA 업데이트/지정: `ca-certificates` 갱신 또는 `--cacert`로 인증서 지정.
- 리다이렉트/압축 처리: `-L --compressed`로 실제 PDF URL까지 따라가기.

**진단용 명령 예시**
```bash
# 1) handshake 상세 보기
curl -v --tlsv1.2 --http1.1 -L -o file.pdf "https://example.gov.kr/path/file.pdf"

# 2) 브라우저 헤더/쿠키 반영 (로그인 필요할 때)
curl -v --tlsv1.2 --http1.1 -L \
  -H "User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0" \
  -H "Referer: https://example.gov.kr" \
  -b "SESSION=..." \
  -o file.pdf "https://example.gov.kr/path/file.pdf"

# 3) 서버 TLS 지원 확인
openssl s_client -connect example.gov.kr:443 -servername example.gov.kr -tls1_2
```

**마지막 수단**
- `-k/--insecure`는 인증서 검증을 끄므로 보안상 비권장입니다. 내부망 테스트 등 제한된 상황에서만 고려하세요.

**참고 स्रोत**
- https://www.codegenes.net/blog/curl-35-openssl-ssl-connect-ssl-error-syscall-in-connection-to-domain-com-443/
- https://www.howtouselinux.com/post/ssl_error_syscall
- https://sosodev.tistory.com/entry/Linux-curl-%EB%A1%9C-%EB%8B%A4%EC%9A%B4%EB%A1%9C%EB%93%9C-%EC%8B%9C-%EC%97%90%EB%9F%AC-%EB%82%98%EA%B3%A0-wget%EC%9C%BC%EB%A1%9C-%EB%8B%A4%EC%9A%B4%EB%A1%9C%EB%93%9C-%EB%AC%B8%EC%A0%9C-%EC%97%86%EB%8A%94-%EA%B2%BD%EC%9A%B0-%EC%95%8C%EC%95%84%EB%B3%B4%EA%B8%B0

원하시면 실제 대상 사이트 URL을 알려 주세요. 그 URL 기준으로 필요한 헤더/쿠키/리다이렉트 흐름을 정확히 잡아 드릴게요.

trajectory.content:
한국 정부사이트 PDF 다운로드에서 `curl`의 `SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL`을 해결하려는 요청으로 보이며, 최신 근거는 2025년 글들이라 2026년 전용 변화는 확인되지 않았습니다. 대신 2025년 기준으로 공통 원인/해결책을 정리해 드립니다.

```bash

curl -v --tlsv1.2 --http1.1 -L -o file.pdf "https://example.gov.kr/path/file.pdf"

# 3) 서버 TLS 지원 확인
```

input: <web-search>Find current information about: CFTC commitments of traders current week report 2025 download txt file</web-search>
output:
Current-week CFTC COT TXT downloads (updated weekly) are linked from the official CFTC COT page and are direct-downloadable:

- COT main index (source of links): `https://www.cftc.gov/MarketReports/CommitmentsofTraders/index.htm`
- Disaggregated futures: `https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/f_disagg.txt`
- Disaggregated futures+options: `https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/c_disagg.txt`
- Financial Futures (legacy-style): `https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/FinFutWk.txt`
- Financial Futures + options: `https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/FinComWk.txt`
- Traders in Financial Futures (TFF): `https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deafut.txt`
- TFF futures+options: `https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deacom.txt`
- Supplemental CIT: `https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deacit.txt`

These URLs always point to the latest weekly update, so they cover 2025 without changing the file name.

If you want a specific category (legacy/Disaggregated/TFF/Supplemental/Financial), tell me which one and I’ll give just that link and a quick column guide.

- TFF futures+options: `https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deacom.txt`
